channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Knizhnik-Zamolodchikov equations and integrable hyperbolic Landau-Zener models
item.description: arXiv:2409.17053v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We study the relationship between integrable Landau-Zener (LZ) models and Knizhnik-Zamolodchikov (KZ) equations. The latter are originally equations for the correlation functions of two-dimensional conformal field theories, but can also be interpreted as multi-time Schr\"odinger equations. The general LZ problem is to find probabilities of tunneling from eigenstates at $t=t_\text{in}$ to eigenstates at $t\to+\infty$ for an $N\times N$ time-dependent Hamiltonian $\hat H(t)$. A number of such problems are exactly solvable in the sense that their tunneling probabilities are elementary functions of Hamiltonian parameters. Recently, it has been proposed that exactly solvable LZ models of this type map to KZ equations. Here we use this connection to identify and solve a class of integrable LZ models with hyperbolic time dependence, $\hat H(t)=\hat A+\hat B/t$, for $N=2, 3$, and $4$, where $\hat A$ and $\hat B$ are time-independent matrices.
item.dc:creator: Suvendu Barik, Lieuwe Bakker, Vladimir Gritsev, Emil A. Yuzbashyan

item.title: Contact line bundles, foliations, and integrability
item.description: arXiv:2502.02935v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We formulate the non-commutative integrability of contact systems on a contact manifold $(M,\mathcal H)$ using the Jacobi structure on the space of sections $\Gamma(L)$ of a contact line bundle $L$. In the cooriented case, if the line bundle is trivial and $\mathcal H$ is the kernel of a globally defined contact form $\alpha$, the Jacobi structure on the space of sections reduces to the standard Jacobi structure on $(M,\alpha)$. We therefore treat contact systems on cooriented and non-cooriented contact manifolds simultaneously. In particular, this allows us to work with dissipative Hamiltonian systems where the Hamiltonian does not have to be preserved by the Reeb vector field.
item.dc:creator: Bozidar Jovanovic

item.title: Dual Theory of Turbulent Mixing
item.description: arXiv:2504.10205v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We present an exact analytical solution for incompressible turbulent mixing governed by the three-dimensional Navier-Stokes equations, with a passive scalar (such as concentration or temperature) advected by the turbulent velocity field. Building on our recent formulation of decaying turbulence via the Euler ensemble, we express the correlation functions of the passive scalar as statistical averages over this ensemble. Employing a novel and significantly simplified method for computing the statistical limit of the Euler ensemble, we derive the scalar energy spectrum and its scaling functions. The leading term of the spectrum exhibits universal decay as $t^{-5/4}$, independent of the Schmidt number - mirroring the decay of turbulent kinetic energy. However, the subleading contributions differ markedly and reveal a rich structure: we obtain a universal closed-form expression involving sums and integrals, with power-law exponents restricted to negative half-integer values. Although the scaling exponents are universal, the corresponding pre-exponential factors show strong dependence on the Schmidt number. This sensitivity may give the appearance of non-universality in direct numerical simulations (DNS), unless properly accounted for.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Migdal
